Orion is a prominent constellation located on the celestial equator and visible 
throughout the world. It is one of the most conspicuous and recognizable 
constellations in the night sky. It was named after Orion, a hunter in Greek 
mythology. Its brightest stars are Rigel (Beta Orionis) and Betelgeuse (Alpha 
Orionis), ..... Three stars compose a small triangle that marks the head.
